feedback: It looks like it was created before I made some changes the skill. The DCs are wrong, it doesn't follow the style guide for skills, it has weird use of of bold, and is otherwise a boring adventure.
Writing issues

Writing a Xanathar heist adventure feels duplicative of Dragon Heist. Its also an incomplete adventure since the rat doesnt seem to do anything. My group would feel left hanging. And Pip is a very cliche name for a halfling.
Feels contradictory - more temple, or just the tunnel to the port? Why are the yuan-ti tunneling? Might want to encourage indicating motivation.

A bunch of nonsensical stuff. You cant make a dracolich from a dragon egg! I dont think there is even a dragon hatchery in Cormyr? The heart of the story about a purple dragon traitor might be a good start but horrible execution.
Very predictable and so straightforward.

Workable but has serious flaws. If the PCs have the contract already, why would the bone devil offer a deal? Combat encounters are way too easy - imps at 12th level is a walkover. Would have liked details about the three sons, and why there is a Temple of Asmodeus under a Temple of Waukeen.
No logical inconsistencies. Does a good job of capturing the feel of the Moonshaes. Encounter balance seems about right.
DCs are too high, even for 15th level. Why does Tam offer a gift? He should ask for something in exchange.
Decent. Probably need to add a better way to flavor/add abilities/reskin generic monsters. Having portraits of PCs would have been a good twist.

Uses em dash - need to add rules to avoid those (reminds of AI writing style). The only way to finish the adventure is another adventure (traveling to Waterdeep). Not good unless we also have a boat travel adventure available.
Mount Sulaer seems to be hallucinated. Encounter balance is being calculated across the entire adventure rather than encounter by encounter. Should be 1 easy or medium encounter and 1 hard.
No notes.
Reminds me of a published WotC adventure in Keys from the Golden Vault. Not sure if 'DC 16 Intelligence puzzle' follows WotC style guide - need to check that.

Eclipse Confrontation uses two different monster names (Spy and Shadow Sorcerer) before giving the actual stat block (Mage). Confusing. Also a bad monster choice for an assassin. Way too many em dashes.
Avoid using the word 'slaves' in adventures. Otherwise a fine Descent into Avernus side trek.
CR 5 Night Hag is not enough of a challenge for a level 9 party. Encounter math needs fixing - relates to broader encounter balance issue.
Interesting use of the Gralhunds since they can be central in Dragon Heist. Consider handling published adventure crossover somehow. Love the 'Dendar will spare you when she wakes' line.
Death Knights don't technically have phylacteries, but a good rule to bend for the story. The adventure alludes to Orel and Varagoth being brothers - should make that concrete rather than implied.

The Dreaming Dark is a faction in Eberron - need terms to avoid from other settings. Use of Elminster is fine here. DC 22 Wis save or 2 levels of exhaustion at entry could easily break the adventure for some groups - needs to be toned down. Encounter balance seems hard but offset by Elminster's aid.
